title: American_Top_40_1986_April_26th
description:
"The numbers get smaller and, what do you know, the hits get bigger."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Casey plays a 1974 recording of John Lennon singing and Julian Lennon playing drums. Julian Lennon is at number 37 with his song "Stick Around."
 
A listener wants to know what act in the rock era has spent the most weeks at number one in a calendar year. Beating the Bee Gees in 1978, Michael Jackson in 1983, and The Beatles in 1964, This fellow holds the record for 1957 AND 1956.

Casey remembers the achievements of rock pioneer Frankie Lymon.

Casey answers the question, "Who in the 80's is the most successful female act on the singles chart?" By this point in the 80's, female act had hit the top 40 twelve times. 

For the longest time, Donnie and Marie Osmond were the only brother and sister act to appear in the top 40 with separate solo hits. In this countdown is the artist who has repeated that feat with TWO different sisters.

Casey also gives an update on The Osmonds.

A man writes in to say he met an Australian man who claimed to have had a top 40 hit over 20 years prior with a song about a kangaroo. The listener wants to know if the story was true. Casey says that man was the first Australian ever to hit the top 40 and gives the details.
